localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
An individual human being.
The unstructured name for the individual.

annotations.comment: The content of this data element may be derived from one or more components from CLUSTER.structured_name combined together as a text string. For example: 'John Markham', 'Professor Sir John Markham', 'John Markham Jnr MP'.

localizedDescriptions.en: A label for the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Neighbour in the house with the red door'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the individual.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow for more than one Identifier to be recorded. Note that the DV_IDENTIFIER data type contains multiple subcomponents for recording the ID value, type, issuer and assigned. For example - social security number; driver's license; or passport number.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the individual.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow for more than one Identifier to be recorded. Note that the DV_IDENTIFIER data type contains multiple subcomponents for recording the ID value, type, issuer and assigned. For example - social security number; driver's license; or passport number.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the individual.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow for more than one Identifier to be recorded. Note that the DV_IDENTIFIER data type contains multiple subcomponents for recording the ID value, type, issuer and assigned. For example - social security number; driver's license; or passport number.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the gender of an individual.
The gender of an individual used for administrative purposes.

annotations.comment: This element is what most systems today describes as 'Sex' or 'Gender'. For example 'Male', 'Female', 'Other'. This aligns with HL7 FHIR 'Person.gender'. Coding with a terminology is recommended, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the age of an individual at a specific point in time.
Duration of time since birth, expressed as a specified age range or grouping.

annotations.comment: Categories for each specific use case will be defined within a template.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the age of an individual at a specific point in time.
Duration of time since birth, expressed as a specified age range or grouping.

annotations.comment: Categories for each specific use case will be defined within a template.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the age of an individual at a specific point in time.
Duration of time since birth, expressed as a specified age range or grouping.

annotations.comment: Categories for each specific use case will be defined within a template.

localizedDescriptions.en: A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
An individual human being.
Details related to the time and place of birth and additional non-clinical context around the birth.
Date and time of birth.
A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
An individual human being.
Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.
The name of the suburb, town, city, village, community or lowest level locality that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the suburb, town, city, village, community or lowest level locality that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia; and the Counties of 'Cornwall', 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' in Jamaica.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of a major government district or geographical area that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'New South Wales' and 'Queensland' in Australia; 'British Columbia' and 'Nova Scotia' in Canada; and the Parishes of 'St. Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Identification of the persistent blood group and rhesus status of an individual.
A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
An individual human being.
Identification of the individual's religious or non-religious beliefs and/or practices by which people order the conduct of their lives both practically and in a moral sense.

annotations.comment: For example: Christianity, Catholicism, Islam, Wiccan, Humanism, Animism, Atheism; Agnosticism; or none.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the belief and/or practice to which the individual is affiliated.

annotations.comment: For example: Christianity; Catholicism; Islam; Wiccan; Humanism; Animism; Atheism; Agnosticism; or none. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the religious affiliation not captured in other fields.
Affiliation, kinship or connection with one or more groupings of people, according to common origins or background.
Name of the ethnic or cultural grouping with whom the individual identifies an affiliation, kinship or connection.

annotations.comment:
For example: Australian; Torres Strait Islander; Maori; Roma Gypsy; Sikh, or Greek.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible - for example ABS 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2019. The occurrences for this data element is set to multiple occurences to allow for more than one social grouping to be selected.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the ethnic or cultural grouping with whom the individual identifies an affiliation, kinship or connection.

annotations.comment:
For example: Australian; Torres Strait Islander; Maori; Roma Gypsy; Sikh, or Greek.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible - for example ABS 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2019. The occurrences for this data element is set to multiple occurences to allow for more than one social grouping to be selected.

localizedDescriptions.en: Group of individuals connected by social interactions and personal relationships.
Single word or phrase that describes an individual's current relationship with a life partner.

annotations.comment: Coding of the partnership status with a terminology is preferred, where possible. There is a huge variation in the value sets used across jurisdictions. Many have local, government-mandated value sets rather than using SNOMED CT or similar. For example: a 'marital status' value set including 'never married' or 'single'; 'married'; 'divorced'; or 'widowed'. Also known as 'civil status', 'union status', or 'relationship status'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary or persistent information about an individual's current and past jobs and/or roles.
Narrative description about the entire occupation history of the individual.
Statement about the individual's current employment.

annotations.comment: For example: employed; unemployed; or not in labour force. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. Detail about each occupation can be recorded within the CLUSTER.occupation_record archetype.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary or persistent information about an individual's current and past education or training.
Description of highest category of education or training completed.

annotations.comment: Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. For example: the ISCED classification, such as upper secondary vocational education; post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education; Bachelor’s or equivalent level, professional; Doctoral or equivalent level, academic; post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education; or never attended an educational program.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary information about the financial situation of an individual.
Details about the financial situation of an individual during a specified period of time.
Narrative description about the financial situation or context.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
An individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening for significant health-related problems found in family members.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Screening details about a specified health problem.

annotations.comment: This grouping is currently  ordered to indicate relationships per problem, but in practice could also be used to capture problems per relationship as Problem/Diagnosis name and Relationship both allow multiple occurrences.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the significant problem or diagnosis in the identified family member.

annotations.comment: Coding of the family member's problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The relationship of the family member to the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: mother, step-father, maternal grandmother, or paternal uncle. Coding of the relationship with a terminology is preferred, where possible and including specification of maternal and paternal as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: The relationship of the family member to the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: mother, step-father, maternal grandmother, or paternal uncle. Coding of the relationship with a terminology is preferred, where possible and including specification of maternal and paternal as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: The relationship of the family member to the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: mother, step-father, maternal grandmother, or paternal uncle. Coding of the relationship with a terminology is preferred, where possible and including specification of maternal and paternal as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: The relationship of the family member to the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: mother, step-father, maternal grandmother, or paternal uncle. Coding of the relationship with a terminology is preferred, where possible and including specification of maternal and paternal as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Summary information about the death of an individual, excluding the cause(s) of death.
Date and/or time of death.

annotations.comment: For example: based on findings pertaining to examination of the corpse and the pathologist's reconstruction of time of death based on post-mortem changes, temperature, etc. May also be known as DOD (date of death). If more than one 'Date of death alternatives' have been proposed, this data element could be renamed in a template as the 'Confirmed/Agreed date of death'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Context or setting of the death.

annotations.comment: It is recommended that 'Manner of death' be coded with an external terminology.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about the context or setting of the death.
The category of the place where the individual died.

annotations.comment: This data element has multiple occurrences to allow more than one level of category, including subcategories about the place of death. It is recommended that 'Place category' be coded with an external terminology. For example: hospital or home; or, within the context of a hospital: ICU; ward; or operating theatre.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about findings that support a clinical assertion.
Measurement or value associated with the finding.

annotations.comment: For example: Mantoux test result.
